labels.analysis: The MCP Server described is a Recipe Assistant Server designed to provide recipe-related data and tools to enhance cooking and meal planning. Its core functionality revolves around accessing, searching, and manipulating recipe information. The available tool, search_meal, allows users to search for meals by name and retrieve cooking instructions. This indicates that the server is primarily focused on culinary knowledge management and meal-related tasks.
labels.reasoning: The primary_label of Content Creation is chosen because the server facilitates the creation and retrieval of recipe content, which is a form of creative culinary writing and guidance. The secondary_labels of Web Search & Research and Daily Productivity are added because the server helps users search for meal information (research aspect) and aids in meal planning (productivity aspect). No custom label is needed as the predefined categories adequately cover the functionality.

tools.name: search_meal
tools.description: Search for a meal by name and return cooking instructions.

server_info_crawled.name: Recipe Assistant Server
server_info_crawled.author: @MuratYurtseven/recipemcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Provide recipe-related data and tools to enhance cooking and meal planning experiences. Enable users to access, search, and manipulate recipe information dynamically through a standardized protocol. Facilitate integration of culinary knowledge into applications seamlessly.

tools.name: search_meal
tools.description: Search for a meal by name and return cooking instructions.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@MuratYurtseven/recipemcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
